golem.util.validation

Class Validation

  • golem.util.validation.Validation

  • public class Validation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ValidationContext testMatrix(Matrix<java.lang.Double> matrix)
      Return a validation context that can be used to validate the given matrix with the default name of "matrix".
      static ValidationContext testMatrix(Matrix<java.lang.Double> matrix, java.lang.String name)
      Return a validation context that can be used to validate the given matrix with the given name.
      static void validate(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.util.validation.ValidationContext,kotlin.Unit> fn)
      Execute the given rules within a ValidationContext, letting you validate multiple matrices at once with interrelated dimensions, and return a list of matrices that match your validation rules.
      static void validate(Matrix<java.lang.Double> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.util.validation.ValidationContext,kotlin.Unit> fn)
      Use the given fn to validate a matrix. Return either the matrix itself or a copy that has been transformed to match the validation rules.

      Use the given fn to validate a matrix with the given name. Return either the matrix itself or a copy that has been transformed to match the validation rules.

    • Method Detail

      • testMatrix

        public static ValidationContext testMatrix(Matrix<java.lang.Double> matrix)

        Return a validation context that can be used to validate the given matrix with the default name of "matrix".

        In general it is preferable to use the other verison of this function that lets you specify a name. All matrices that are validated with this method will appear in the error message with the name "matrix"

        Parameters:
        matrix - A matrix to validate.

      • testMatrix

        public static ValidationContext testMatrix(Matrix<java.lang.Double> matrix,
                                           java.lang.String name)

        Return a validation context that can be used to validate the given matrix with the given name.

        Parameters:
        matrix - A matrix to validate.
        name - The name of the matrix (used in displayed errors)

      • validate

        public static void validate(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.util.validation.ValidationContext,kotlin.Unit> fn)

        Execute the given rules within a ValidationContext, letting you validate multiple matrices at once with interrelated dimensions, and return a list of matrices that match your validation rules.

      • validate

        public static void validate(Matrix<java.lang.Double> $receiver,
                            kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.util.validation.ValidationContext,kotlin.Unit> fn)

        Use the given fn to validate a matrix. Return either the matrix itself or a copy that has been transformed to match the validation rules.

        In general it is preferable to use the other verison of this function that lets you specify a name. All matrices that are validated with this method will appear in the error message with the name "matrix"

        Parameters:
        fn - Validation rules for the matrix.
        See Also:
        interface Matrix

      • validate

        public static void validate(Matrix<java.lang.Double> $receiver,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.util.validation.ValidationContext,kotlin.Unit> fn)

        Use the given fn to validate a matrix with the given name. Return either the matrix itself or a copy that has been transformed to match the validation rules.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the matrix (used in displayed errors)
        fn - Validation rules for the matrix.
